ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Spatial forecast verification arose from verifying high-resolution forecasts, where coarser-resolution models generally are favored even when a human forecaster finds the higher-resolution model to be considerably better.  Most newly proposed methods, which largely come from image analysis, computer vision, and similar, are available, with more on the way.

Spatial forecast verification arose from verifying high-resolution forecasts, where coarser-resolution models generally are favored even when a human forecaster finds the higher-resolution model to be considerably better.  Most newly proposed methods, which largely come from image analysis, computer vision, and similar, are available, with more on the way.

name: r-spatialvx
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0-3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-spatialvx
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/SpatialVx_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/SpatialVx/SpatialVx_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 967c7f533c03c42057b7b3fffeb2861f9ee7b8643bea298014768b32a9ae26e0

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-circstats
    - r-boot
    - r-distillery
    - r-fastcluster
    - r-fields >=6.8
    - r-maps
    - r-smatr
    - r-smoothie
    - r-spatstat
    - r-turboem
    - r-waveslim
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-circstats
    - r-boot
    - r-distillery
    - r-fastcluster
    - r-fields >=6.8
    - r-maps
    - r-smatr
    - r-smoothie
    - r-spatstat
    - r-turboem
    - r-waveslim

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('SpatialVx')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('SpatialVx')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://www.ral.ucar.edu/projects/icp/SpatialVx
  license: GPL-2.0-or-later
  summary: Spatial forecast verification arose from verifying high-resolution forecasts, where coarser-resolution models generally are favored even when a human forecaster finds the higher-resolution model to be considerably better.  Most newly proposed methods, which largely come from image analysis, computer vision, and
    similar, are available, with more on the way.
  license_family: GPL3
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: SpatialVx
# Version: 0.6-5
# Date: 2019-06-10
# Title: Spatial Forecast Verification
# Author: Eric Gilleland <EricG@ucar.edu>
# Maintainer: Eric Gilleland <EricG@ucar.edu>
# Depends: R (>= 2.10.0), spatstat (>= 1.37-0), fields (>= 6.8), smoothie, smatr, turboEM
# Imports: distillery, maps, boot, CircStats, fastcluster, waveslim
# Description: Spatial forecast verification arose from verifying high-resolution forecasts, where coarser-resolution models generally are favored even when a human forecaster finds the higher-resolution model to be considerably better.  Most newly proposed methods, which largely come from image analysis, computer vision, and similar, are available, with more on the way.
# License: GPL (>= 2)
# URL: http://www.ral.ucar.edu/projects/icp/SpatialVx
# BugReports: http://www.ral.ucar.edu/staff/ericg
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-06-10 15:46:47 UTC; eric
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-06-11 17:10:02 UTC
